message: Just posted on HN http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2485474
the design is good though
lost by 'city guide built by you'
lost me by*
just crowd sourcing strategies rub me the wrong way
no I didn't build it and no I don't want to jump into another crowd sourcing scam where users build the value of a company and get little to nothing in return
it's actually a pretty awesome website though :P
I love this project. It is what I've failed with my first startup HiNii. You let me know how can I have fun in my city, doing "strange"/funny things ;) good start
@heri This existing data is just from me and my friends but the idea is that you can add stuff to it easily as well.
how do you get the data?
Hi everyone... sorry I'm in class.

@apphacker I understand that crowdsourcing rubs some people the wrong way but I wanted to also create value directly for users. So: 1) users can create their own profiles to share with their friends (that means they can customize their backgrounds/profilepics) and 2) they get Up points where we reward the best users with dinners/adventures on us.
@CrowderSoup More cities are coming soon... I just want to do one city right first.
Thank you everyone for their feedback!
Great start! How about making more cities available ;) I'd like to see Salt Lake City on something like this so I can see how it really works for me.
any feature requests?
You should partner with AirBnB
You could help people find stuff to do in that city after they rent a bed their
there*
It's not available in my city so it's hard to give you a good rating.
PS: There is a lot of awesomeness in your site.
I have a feature request: Use the same filter for user names that twitter uses. Right now I can't register with martin_sunset. I like the design, well done
You should add your site to http://startupli.st and you'll gain early adopters, social proof, and traction. Guaranteed.
@nickfrost Thanks. I will do. We're going to do our big marketing thing in a couple weeks when we get all the bugs kinked out (as well as make some of the improvements that HN people have suggested)
